document_type: ISO 27001 Security Requirements - Annex A Control
applies_to_note: All gambling operators subject to RTS Chapter 4 - Security Requirements

control.control_purpose: To ensure proper entity authentication and prevent failures of authentication processes
control.control_objective: Control allocation and management of authentication information throughout its lifecycle to ensure only authorized entities gain access to systems and resources

iso_27001_definition.official_text: Allocation and management of authentication information should be controlled by a management process, including advising personnel on the appropriate handling of authentication information.
key_requirements: Allocation of authentication information controlled by management process
Management of authentication information controlled by management process
Personnel advised on appropriate handling of authentication information

authentication_information_overview.definition: Authentication information is the information used to gain access to systems and resources
authentication_information_overview.purpose: Proves identity of entity accessing systems - primary mechanism to ensure only authorized entities gain access
authentication_information_overview.relationship_to_identity: Works in conjunction with identity management (A 5.16) - identity is the account, authentication information proves you are that account
authentication_information_overview.importance: Authentication information is fundamental to access control - restricting access requires authentication to prove entity requesting access is authorized

implementation_requirements.requirement: Implement Management Process for Authentication Information
implementation_requirements.description: Authentication information allocation and management controlled by formal management process

details.key_point: Must be a managed, controlled process - not ad hoc or informal

implementation_requirements.requirement: Generate Temporary Authentication Information for First Use
implementation_requirements.description: When accounts are created, temporary authentication information should be generated for first-time use

details.approach: Consider automatic generation of temporary passwords
details.benefits: More efficient than manual creation, reduces human error
requirements: Temporary authentication information is hard to guess
Temporary authentication information is unique for each person
Temporary information must be changed on first use - mandatory change enforced
Temporary passwords never reused across multiple users
details.first_login_requirement: User must be forced to change temporary credentials immediately upon first login

implementation_requirements.description: Check and verify identity of person making request and person being given new, updated or replacement credentials

details.verification_requirement: Do not give access to 'any old Tom, Dick or Harry' - verify identity appropriately
details.same_person: Requestor and recipient may or may not be same person - verify appropriately for context
details.process_integration: Verification should be integrated into approval process from identity management control

implementation_requirements.description: When sending authentication information to people, use secure methods

prohibited_methods: Do not send via unencrypted email
Do not send via clear text communication
Do not send through unsecured channels
details.required_approach: Use secure delivery methods appropriate for sensitivity level

implementation_requirements.description: Users acknowledge they have received authentication information

details.requirement: User must confirm receipt - do not assume delivery means receipt
details.purpose: Verify user has received information and responsibility transfers to user

implementation_requirements.requirement: Maintain Records of Allocated Authentication Information
implementation_requirements.description: Keep records of what authentication information has been allocated and managed

details.protection: Protect the record itself - authentication information records are sensitive
details.security: Encrypt records containing authentication information references

implementation_requirements.description: If vendor or supplier provides default passwords, PINs or authentication information, change immediately

details.requirement: Do not use any default authentication information provided by vendors
details.timing: Change must happen immediately - before any production use
details.reason: Default credentials are publicly available and discoverable - security risk

implementation_requirements.description: Where passwords are used, implement strong password requirements

strength_requirements: Passwords not based on dictionary words
Passwords not based on information someone could find out
details.guidance: Avoid common/predictable patterns - no birthdays, names, dictionary words
details.minimum_length: Standard requires minimum length (guidance on specific length varies by organization)
details.note: Dictionary phrases can actually be strong passwords but require specific composition rules

implementation_requirements.description: Ideally, authentication information not reused across different systems

details.principle: Each system should have unique authentication information
details.rationale: If one system is compromised, other systems remain secure
details.best_practice: Promote unique credentials for each system
details.implementation: Password managers can assist with unique credential management

implementation_requirements.description: Contracts of employment include obligation to follow authentication information rules

details.contract_clause: Employment contract explicitly includes requirements to
details.consequences: Contract should include consequences of violating authentication policies

implementation_requirements.description: Users have responsibility for their own authentication information

user_responsibilities: Not to share passwords or secret authentication information
Not to write down passwords in unprotected locations
Report compromise or suspected compromise immediately
Use unique authentication information for each system
details.employer_obligation: Advise personnel on appropriate handling of authentication information

implementation_requirements.description: If authentication information is compromised or suspected compromised, change immediately

details.response: Change authentication information immediately upon notification
details.process: Have emergency change process for urgent credential changes
details.communication: Notify user of compromise and forced change

implementation_requirements.description: Accept that other authentication methods exist beyond passwords

details.rationale: Passwords alone are increasingly inadequate for security
details.implementation: Encourage and implement multi-factor authentication where possible

implementation_requirements.description: Find balance on password change frequency based on risk and business need

details.consideration: Frequent password changes can reduce security (users write them down, use predictable changes)
details.standard_acknowledgment: ISO acknowledges this - scenario where frequent changes not required is acceptable
details.documentation: Be able to justify password change frequency to auditor
details.flexibility: Forced frequent changes not absolute requirement if risk-justified

password_management_system_guidance.description: Recommended capabilities for password management systems

capabilities.requirement: Users allowed to select and change their own passwords
capabilities.detail: Provides user autonomy while maintaining control

capabilities.requirement: Enforce strong passwords according to policy
capabilities.detail: System validates against organization's strength requirements

capabilities.requirement: Force users to change passwords at first use
Force password changes as required by security events
capabilities.detail: After security incident, after compromise, after admin override
Maintain history of previous passwords, prevent cycling
Check against dictionary of commonly used passwords

capabilities.requirement: Take account of compromised accounts and prevent use
capabilities.detail: Check against known breach databases, prevent known-compromised passwords

capabilities.requirement: Do not display passwords on screen when entered
capabilities.detail: Mask password input with asterisks or dots

capabilities.requirement: Do not store or send passwords in clear text
capabilities.detail: All password storage encrypted, all transmission encrypted
Use strong hashing algorithms (bcrypt, scrypt, argon2)

steps.detail: Document requirements for authentication information allocation and management
Specify strength requirements, minimum length, change frequency, alternative methods
Define how to verify requestor and recipient identity before allocation
Implement secure method for transmitting authentication information to users
Automate generation of unique temporary credentials with mandatory first-use change

steps.action: Select and Deploy Password Management System
steps.detail: Implement system with required capabilities for password management
Identify and change all default passwords, PINs, credentials from vendors
Implement system to track allocation and management of authentication information
Define process for immediate credential changes upon compromise
Train all staff on authentication information handling, password requirements, reporting

compliance_checklist.description: Steps to comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 5.17

checklist.item: Implement authentication information policy and process
Define and enforce strong password requirements
Establish secure delivery of authentication information
Require mandatory password change on first login
Implement password management system with required capabilities
Document user responsibilities in employment contracts

common_mistakes.description: Top 3 mistakes organizations make with authentication information

mistakes.description: People share authentication information when they should not, resulting in shared accounts and compromised access control
root_cause: Lazy administration - easier to share than create separate account
No enforcement of policy against sharing
mistakes.impact: Access control breaks down - cannot track who did what, accountability lost
mistakes.prevention: Create separate identities and authentication information for each user
mistakes.correct_approach: One user to one unique identity - enforce always
mistakes.audit_risk: High - auditors look for account sharing

mistakes.description: Organization reuses same temporary password across all new user onboarding
mistakes.example: Sending 'P@ssw0rd' as temporary password to every new hire
root_cause: No automation of unique temporary credential generation
mistakes.impact: If anyone learns temporary password pattern, can access multiple accounts
mistakes.prevention: Automate unique temporary credential generation for each user
mistakes.best_practice: Each user receives cryptographically unique temporary credential
mistakes.audit_risk: High - easy for auditor to identify

mistakes.mistake: Document and version control is wrong
mistakes.description: Poor documentation and version control of authentication policies and procedures
issues: Version numbers don't match across references
No evidence of review in 12 months
Multiple versions of same policy in circulation
prevention: Match version numbers across all references
mistakes.impact: Shows lack of control and organization
mistakes.audit_risk: Massive own goal - signals poor information security management

audit_requirements.description: What auditors will check during ISO 27001 A 5.17 audit

audit_areas.description: Auditor checks that authentication information allocation and management process is documented and followed
checks: Policy documented for authentication information management
Process documented for allocation of authentication information
Process documented for management of authentication information
Approval and allocation process evidence in operation
Recent hires have authentication information allocation documentation
Temporary passwords are unique and forced to change on first login
Verification of identity occurred before allocation
Audit trail of allocation and changes maintained
audit_areas.best_practice: Maintain documented evidence of all authentication processes
audit_areas.test_audit_trail: Auditor may ask to see recent user setup and confirm temporary password was unique and changed on first login

audit_areas.description: Verify documented procedures exist, are followed, and personnel are trained
checks: User responsibilities documented in employment contracts
No account sharing or policy violations
Emergency change process documented and usable
audit_areas.biggest_gotcha: Finding people share accounts because they had to - no alternative access method

audit_areas.description: Verify systems are configured to enforce authentication requirements
checks: Password manager system enforces strong passwords
Temporary passwords forced to change at first login
Passwords not displayed on screen during entry
Passwords not stored in clear text

audit_areas.description: Review authentication information records and documentation
checks: Documentation up to date and reviewed in last 12 months
audit_areas.warning: Poor documentation is a massive own goal

policies_required.question: What policies do I need for ISO 27001 Annex A 5.17 Authentication Information?
policies_required.answer: You will need the ISO 27001 Access Control Policy Template plus authentication-specific policies covering password requirements, allocation procedures, user responsibilities, and incident response

importance.question: Why is ISO 27001 Authentication Information important?
importance.answer: Authentication information is the primary mechanism for proving identity and controlling access to systems and resources. Without proper authentication information management, access control fails and accountability is lost. It is fundamental to protecting all information assets

certification_requirement.question: Do I have to satisfy ISO 27001 Annex A 5.17 for ISO 27001 Certification?
certification_requirement.answer: Yes. While Annex A clauses are for consideration in Statement of Applicability, there is no valid reason to exclude authentication information. It is fundamental to any information security control framework and is explicitly required for ISO 27001 certification

write_policies_yourself.question: Can I write policies for ISO 27001 Annex A 5.17 myself?
write_policies_yourself.answer: Yes, you can write policies yourself. You will need a copy of the standard and approximately 5 days of focused time. It would be advantageous to have background in information security management systems. Multiple supporting documents are required in addition to the policy

templates_availability.question: Where can I get templates for ISO 27001 Annex A 5.17?
templates_availability.answer: ISO 27001 templates supporting authentication information are available in ISO 27001 Toolkits

implementation_difficulty.question: How hard is ISO 27001 Annex A 5.17?
implementation_difficulty.answer: ISO 27001 Authentication Information is challenging due to extensive documentation requirements and system configuration needs. Templates are recommended to fast-track implementation

implementation_timeline.question: How long will ISO 27001 Annex A 5.17 take me?
implementation_timeline.answer: From scratch with full implementation: 1 to 3 months. With proper templates, toolkit, and risk management approach: less than 1 day

implementation_cost.question: What will ISO 27001 Annex A 5.17 cost me?
implementation_cost.answer: If done yourself: free but 1-3 months of resource time (opportunity cost). With toolkit and templates: minimal cost but significant time savings and better quality
